    • Method Detail

      • buildInfoDialog

        public static android.app.AlertDialog.Builder buildInfoDialog(@NonNull
                                                              android.app.Activity activity,
                                                              @StringRes
                                                              int title,
                                                              @StringRes
                                                              int message,
                                                              @StringRes
                                                              int neutralButtonName,
                                                              @NonNull
                                                              android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Builds AlertDialog which shows only information to the User and has only neutral button for feedback. Note: You should always call the show() method to pop-up the message on the device screen.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity which this AlertDialog will be attached to.
        title - int - The string resource which will be displayed as Title.
        message - int - The string resource which will be displayed as informational message.
        neutralButtonName - int - The string resource which will be displayed as neutral button.
        listener - DialogInterface.OnClickListener - Callback that will be attached as listener, when the neutral button has been pressed.
        Returns:
        AlertDialog.Builder- The built AlertDialog which should be displayed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • buildInfoDialog

        public static android.app.AlertDialog.Builder buildInfoDialog(@NonNull
                                                              android.app.Activity activity,
                                                              @StringRes
                                                              int title,
                                                              @StringRes
                                                              int message,
                                                              @StringRes
                                                              int neutralButtonName,
                                                              @DrawableRes
                                                              int icon,
                                                              @NonNull
                                                              android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Builds AlertDialog which shows only information to the User and has only neutral button for feedback. Note: You should always call the show() method to pop-up the message on the device screen.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity, which this AlertDialog will be attached to.
        title - int - The string resource, which will be displayed as Title.
        message - int - The string resource, which will be displayed as informational message.
        neutralButtonName - int - The string resource, which will be displayed as neutral button.
        icon - int - The drawable resource, which will be used to be displayed as an icon next to the message title.
        listener - DialogInterface.OnClickListener - Callback that will be attached as listener, when the neutral button has been pressed.
        Returns:
        AlertDialog.Builder- The built AlertDialog which should be displayed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • buildInfoDialog

        public static android.app.AlertDialog.Builder buildInfoDialog(@NonNull
                                                              android.app.Activity activity,
                                                              @NonNull
                                                              java.lang.String title,
                                                              @NonNull
                                                              java.lang.String message,
                                                              @StringRes
                                                              int neutralButtonName,
                                                              @DrawableRes
                                                              int icon,
                                                              @NonNull
                                                              android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Builds AlertDialog which shows only information to the User and has only neutral button for feedback, and also custom dialog icon. Note: You should always call the show() method to pop-up the message on the device screen.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity, which this AlertDialog will be attached to.
        title - String - The string, which will be displayed as Title.
        message - String - The string, which will be displayed as an informational message.
        neutralButtonName - int - The string resource, which will be displayed as neutral button.
        icon - int - The drawable resource, which will be used to be displayed as an icon next to the message title.
        listener - DialogInterface.OnClickListener - Callback that will be attached as listener, when the neutral button has been pressed.
        Returns:
        AlertDialog.Builder- The built AlertDialog which should be displayed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • buildSelectFromListDialog

        public static android.app.AlertDialog.Builder buildSelectFromListDialog(@NonNull
                                                                        android.app.Activity activity,
                                                                        @StringRes
                                                                        int title,
                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                        android.view.View optionalView,
                                                                        @StringRes
                                                                        int positiveButtonName,
                                                                        @StringRes
                                                                        int negativeButtonName,
                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                        android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener negativeListener,
                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                        android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener positiveListener)
        Builds AlertDialog which shows list for selection represented as an optional view parameter. The alert dialog has positive and negative buttons for feedback. Note: You should always call the show() method to pop-up the message on the device screen.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity which this AlertDialog will be attached to.
        title - int - The string resource which will be displayed as Title.
        optionalView - View - The view which will be added to the Dialog under the title.
        positiveButtonName - int - The string resource which will be displayed as positive button label.
        negativeButtonName - int - The string resource which will be displayed as negative button label.
        negativeListener - DialogInterface.OnClickListener - The callback that will be called when the negative button is pressed.
        positiveListener - DialogInterface.OnClickListener - The callback that will be called when the positive button is pressed.
        Returns:
        AlertDialog.Builder - The built AlertDialog which will be displayed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • buildCustomContextMenuDialog

        public static android.app.AlertDialog.Builder buildCustomContextMenuDialog(@NonNull
                                                                           android.app.Activity activity,
                                                                           @NonNull
                                                                           android.widget.ListView listView)
        Builds AlertDialog which shows list of items represented as an ListView parameter. The alert dialog does NOT have any buttons for feedback. Note: You should always call the show() method to pop-up the message on the device screen.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity which this AlertDialog will be attached to.
        listView - View - The ListView which will be used to represent the context items.
        Returns:
        AlertDialog.Builder - The built AlertDialog which will be displayed.
        Since:
        1.04

      • buildPositiveNegativeDialog

        public static android.app.AlertDialog.Builder buildPositiveNegativeDialog(@NonNull
                                                                          android.app.Activity activity,
                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                          java.lang.String title,
                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                          android.view.View optionalView,
                                                                          @StringRes
                                                                          int positiveButtonName,
                                                                          @StringRes
                                                                          int negativeButtonName,
                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                          android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener negativeListener,
                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                          android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener positiveListener)
        Builds AlertDialog which has an optional view with position under the dialog Title. The Title is a String parameter. The alert dialog has positive and negative buttons for feedback. Note: You should always call the show() method to pop-up the message on the device screen.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity which this AlertDialog will be attached to.
        title - int - The string resource which will be displayed as Title.
        optionalView - View - The view which will be added to the Dialog under the title.
        positiveButtonName - int - The string resource which will be displayed as positive button label.
        negativeButtonName - int - The string resource which will be displayed as negative button label.
        negativeListener - DialogInterface.OnClickListener - The callback that will be called when the negative button is pressed.
        positiveListener - DialogInterface.OnClickListener - The callback that will be called when the positive button is pressed.
        Returns:
        AlertDialog.Builder - The built AlertDialog which will be displayed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • buildPositiveNegativeDialog

        public static android.app.AlertDialog.Builder buildPositiveNegativeDialog(@NonNull
                                                                          android.app.Activity activity,
                                                                          int title,
                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                          android.view.View optionalView,
                                                                          @StringRes
                                                                          int positiveButtonName,
                                                                          @StringRes
                                                                          int negativeButtonName,
                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                          android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener negativeListener,
                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                          android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener positiveListener)
        Builds AlertDialog which has an optional view with position under the dialog Title. The Title is an int id of the string resource. The alert dialog has positive and negative buttons for feedback. Note: You should always call the show() method to pop-up the message on the device screen.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity which this AlertDialog will be attached to.
        title - int - The string resource which will be displayed as Title.
        optionalView - View - The view which will be added to the Dialog under the title.
        positiveButtonName - int - The string resource which will be displayed as positive button label.
        negativeButtonName - int - The string resource which will be displayed as negative button label.
        negativeListener - DialogInterface.OnClickListener - The callback that will be called when the negative button is pressed.
        positiveListener - DialogInterface.OnClickListener - The callback that will be called when the positive button is pressed.
        Returns:
        AlertDialog.Builder - The built AlertDialog which should be displayed.
        Since:
        1.06

      • buildNeutralOptionsDialog

        public static android.app.AlertDialog.Builder buildNeutralOptionsDialog(@NonNull
                                                                        android.app.Activity activity,
                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                        java.lang.String title,
                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                        android.view.View optionalView,
                                                                        @StringRes
                                                                        int neutralButtonName,
                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                        android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener neutralListener)
        Builds AlertDialog which has optional View under the Title and a neutral button for feedback. Note: You should always call the show() method to pop-up the message on the device screen.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity which this AlertDialog will be attached to.
        title - String - The string resource which will be displayed as Title.
        optionalView - View - The view which will be added to the Dialog under the title.
        neutralButtonName - int - The string resource which will be displayed as positive button label.
        neutralListener - DialogInterface.OnClickListener - The callback that will be called when the positive button is pressed.
        Returns:
        AlertDialog.Builder - The built AlertDialog which will be displayed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • showToastMessage

        public static void showToastMessage(@NonNull
                                    android.content.Context context,
                                    @NonNull
                                    java.lang.String message)
        Shows up a Toast message with SHORT duration. The message should be a String.
        Parameters:
        context - Context - The context that the Toast will be attached to.
        message - String - The String that will be shown as a message in the Toast.
        Since:
        1.05

      • showToastMessage

        public static void showToastMessage(@NonNull
                                    android.content.Context context,
                                    @StringRes
                                    int messageResId)
        Shows up a Toast message with SHORT duration. The message parameter should be the int id of the string resource.
        Parameters:
        context - Context - The context that the Toast will be attached to.
        messageResId - int - The id of the string resource which will be shown as a message.
        Since:
        1.05

      • initCredentialsDialogViews

        public static android.widget.LinearLayout initCredentialsDialogViews(@NonNull
                                                                     android.app.Activity activity)
        Initializes the container layout and the views for the Credentials Dialog.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity which the Alert Dialog will be attached to.
        Returns:
        LinearLayout - The Linear layout which will be used as an optional View and container.
        Since:
        1.07

      • buildProgressDialog

        @Deprecated
public static android.app.ProgressDialog buildProgressDialog(@NonNull
                                                                          android.content.Context context,
                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                          java.lang.String message)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated. The ProgressDialog has been deprecated by Google, since the API 26 (Android 8 - code name 'O'). The functionality should remain working, but Google suggests us using the ProgressBar instead.
        Parameters:
        context - Context - The activity context for this ProgressDialog.
        message - String - The message, which will appear in the ProgressDialog.
        Returns:
        ProgressDialog - Returns instance of the ProgressDialog. Don't forget to call the show() method.
